Belgium: Peace of Münster ends the war with the Dutch Republic.
Brazil: First Battle of Guararapes: the Portuguese army defeats the Dutch army in the northeast of Brazil.
France: Fronde: Cardinal Mazarin ordered the arrest of the leaders of the parlement of Paris, which provoked widespread rioting. Thirty Years' War: The Peace of Westphalia ended the war with France obtaining the better bargain, and annexing eastern territories.
Germany: Thirty Years' War: The Peace of Westphalia was concluded, ending the war and granting Switzerland and the Netherlands independence from the Holy Roman Empire.
Poland:
Khmelnytsky Uprising begins
Death of Władysław IV Waza
Election of John II Casimir Vasa
Russia: Khmelnytsky Uprising: A Polish szlachta, Bohdan Khmelnytsky, leads the Cossacks of the Zaporizhian Sich against the Polish Crown. Salt Riot: Upset over the introduction of a salt tax, the townspeople launched a rebellion in Moscow. Salt Riot: A group of nobles demanded a zemsky sobor on behalf of the rebellion. Salt Riot: Many of the rebellion's leaders were executed. Khmelnytsky Uprising: Khmelnytsky entered the Ukrainian capital, Kiev.
Spain: The Treaty of Westphalia was signed. Habsburg supremacy was curtailed. Recognition of the independence of the Dutch Republic by the Spanish Empire. Recognition of Spanish sovereignty of Southern Netherlands and Luxembourg by the Dutch Republic.
Sweden: Thirty Years' War ends, with Sweden among the winners; Peace of Westphalia grants Sweden the provinces of Western Pomerania, Wismar, and the bishoprics of Bremen-Verden
Switzerland: The Treaty of Westphalia ends the Thirty Years War and contains a special provision on Switzerland, endorsing the process begun in 1499. With this treaty, European powers recognise the Swiss Confederation as an independent state.
